Test Name: Chlamydia trachomatis and Neisseria gonorrhoeae Nucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT)
Specimen Type: Swab specimens from miscellaneous sites (rectal, pharyngeal, conjunctival, etc.) and urine
Purpose: To detect Chlamydia trachomatis and Neisseria gonorrhoeae nucleic acids in patient specimens.
Container: Manufacturer-provided collection devices with transport media for nucleic acid preservation
Equipment: Real-time PCR instrument (e.g., Cepheid GeneXpert, Roche Cobas, Hologic Panther), calibrated pipettes, vortex mixer, centrifuge
